name: places/ChIJD8De0zz2wokR6Lzc2daw8sQ
formattedAddress: 125 W 109th St # 2, New York, NY 10025, USA
adrFormatAddress: 125 W 109th St # 2, New York, NY 10025-2688, USA

originalText.text: My daughter was a student here for two years. She was in the 3s classroom and the 2s classroom! Her teachers were very informative, loving and overall just a joy! I loved the family atmosphere they had, every teacher knew every child and parent, if you had something going on and needed someone to talk to without being judged there was someone always there. The director and educational director are both involved and invested in the children’s learning as well. I recommend this place to everyone.

text.text: My daughter was a student here for two years. She was in the 3s classroom and the 2s classroom! Her teachers were very informative, loving and overall just a joy! I loved the family atmosphere they had, every teacher knew every child and parent, if you had something going on and needed someone to talk to without being judged there was someone always there. The director and educational director are both involved and invested in the children’s learning as well. I recommend this place to everyone.

originalText.text:
Horrible, the teacher with the blonde hair, Jacqueline Deleon, yells at children, has no patience, which I’m still wondering why she still works there. The other teacher Gina, from the other room is horrible as well. She is definitely not a joyous, professional, preschool teacher. She put her hands on my son and when I went to confront her she told me not to bring my son to school anymore then, if that’s how I feel. No apology, nothing from her.
And when I told the director, Jose Velilla, about it, he simply said, well maybe she was just having a bad day. I was shocked, none of the teachers are professional, they’re always in a bad mood, always with an attitude.

They all lack professionalism and are not there for the children, they are there for a quick paycheck. If you’re kids attend this preschool, walk in unannounced without anyone knowing, just so you can walk in on these teachers screaming at these children. I regret not making a police report.

Jacqueline Deleon, the way you scream and yell, in the manner that you do is superfluous. You yell and scream to these children in a very unprofessional and disrespectful way.
I think that you are unprofessional for the way you treat these children. And I hope that you are removed from working with children. I have confronted you multiple times, I have no problem. Trust me I am a lioness when it comes to my child and will not let an illiterate individual like yourself disrespect my child. I’ve told Jose and the school know about the situation at the time but unfortunately nothing was done. I hope with this post parents can reconsider putting their children in this school.

originalText.text: A safe place to explore and have fun!
